alert.note: Alert for Cleveland; Lincoln; McClain; Pottawatomie; Seminole (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 3:44AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Seminole, southeastern Lincoln, southeastern Cleveland, Pottawatomie and southeastern McClain Counties through 415 AM CDT... At 343 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking the leading edge of winds from multiple small thunderstorms and showers along a line extending from 3 miles north of Sparks to near Etowah to 4 miles northwest of Purcell. Movement was southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Southeastern Norman, Shawnee, Seminole, Tecumseh, Purcell, Noble, Slaughterville, Stroud, Prague, Lexington, Meeker, Maud, Wayne, Earlsboro, Bowlegs, Asher, Tribbey, Wanette, Byars, and Johnson. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 89 and 97. Interstate 40 between mile markers 183 and 212. Interstate 44 between mile markers 177 and 180. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
